weekly_top_story.headline: Subcutaneous Amivantamab Shows 45% Overall Response Rate in Recurrent or Metastatic Head and Neck Cancer
weekly_top_story.summary: Johnson & Johnson announced that amivantamab administered subcutaneously achieved a promising 45% overall response rate with a median duration of 7.2 months in a Phase 1b/2 study for recurrent or metastatic head and neck cancer, potentially offering a more convenient and effective treatment option for this difficult-to-treat population.
weekly_top_story.source: Johnson & Johnson (Press Release via PR Newswire)

stories.headline: Federal Government Shutdown Continues as Senate Fails to Advance Short-Term Funding Bill
stories.summary: The ongoing federal government shutdown, now more than a week old, risks disrupting healthcare operations, research funding, and access to services, with uncertainty about when a resolution will be reached[4].

stories.headline: Clinicians Waste 88 Minutes Per Day on Administrative Tasks, Hampers Patient Care
stories.summary: A report reveals clinicians currently spend an average of 88 minutes daily on administrative tasks, highlighting ongoing inefficiencies in electronic health records and workflow that undermine productivity and patient care[8].
